values.description:
* incremental
* incremental
* added spinning out detection
* wamv-locked by plugin permanetely
* cleaning

This fixes the wamv being pushed away in a perception task. Wamv spins out of control if wind is present.

values.description: World files in wave\_gazebo package switched over to xacro definitions for including xacro version of wave model and to be consistent with [PR #150](#!/osrf/vrx/pull-requests/new?source=xacro_for_oceanwaves&t=1).
values.title: Modiying world definitions in wave_gazebo package to use xacro

summary.raw: World files in wave\_gazebo package switched over to xacro definitions for including xacro version of wave model and to be consistent with [PR #150](#!/osrf/vrx/pull-requests/new?source=xacro_for_oceanwaves&t=1).
summary.html: World files in wave_gazebo package switched over to xacro definitions for including xacro version of wave model and to be consistent with PR #150.

values.description:
For Gazebo playback, it is valuable to have the option to set the verbose and paused Gazebo arguments.

Particularly, for video generation, we want to start the simulation paused so that it can wait for the client to start before starting the video \(otherwise, the boat would start moving before the client is up, so it will be partway into playback before showing anything. Also, having verbose output may be valuable.
values.title: Add verbose and paused option for improved playback

summary.raw:
For Gazebo playback, it is valuable to have the option to set the verbose and paused Gazebo arguments.

Particularly, for video generation, we want to start the simulation paused so that it can wait for the client to start before starting the video \(otherwise, the boat would start moving before the client is up, so it will be partway into playback before showing anything. Also, having verbose output may be valuable.
summary.html:
For Gazebo playback, it is valuable to have the option to set the verbose and paused Gazebo arguments.

Particularly, for video generation, we want to start the simulation paused so that it can wait for the client to start before starting the video (otherwise, the boat would start moving before the client is up, so it will be partway into playback before showing anything. Also, having verbose output may be valuable.

values.description:
demo:

`roscd vrx_gazebo`

`mkdir -p ~/worlds ~/world_xacros`

``roslaunch vrx_gazebo generate_worlds.launch requested:=`pwd`/worlds/yamls/nav_challenge_shallow.yaml world_xacro_target:=$HOME/world_xacros/ world_target:=$HOME/worlds/``

`roslaunch vrx_gazebo sandisland.launch world:=$HOME/worlds/nav_challenge_shallow0.world`

`rostopic list`

observe the presence of `/vrx/task/info`
values.title: added scoring plugin to the nav_challenge xacro for world generation

summary.html:
demo:

roscd vrx_gazebo

mkdir -p ~/worlds ~/world_xacros

roslaunch vrx_gazebo generate_worlds.launch requested:=`pwd`/worlds/yamls/nav_challenge_shallow.yaml world_xacro_target:=$HOME/world_xacros/ world_target:=$HOME/worlds/

roslaunch vrx_gazebo sandisland.launch world:=$HOME/worlds/nav_challenge_shallow0.world

rostopic list

observe the presence of /vrx/task/info

values.description:
This pull request creates deterministic wind when the same seed is used.

How do I test it?

1\. Edit `vrx_gazebo/worlds/example_course.world.xacro` and replace the line `<xacro:usv_wind_gazebo>` with `<xacro:usv_wind_gazebo seed = "10">`.

2\. Additionally, add the following block of code in `usv_gazebo_plugins/src/usv_gazebo_wind_plugin.cc` after line 217 `double randomDist = dist(*this->randGenerator);` :

```
static int counter = 0;
if (counter < 3)
{
  std::cerr << randomDist << std::endl;
  ++counter;
}
```

3\. Recompile and launch VRX: `roslaunch vrx_gazebo vrx.launch`

4\. Confirm that you’re now using the custom seed:

```
[Msg] Random seed value = 10
```

and that you always get the same wind values for this seed:

```
-0.0512656
1.23919
-0.376303
```

‌

Besides the change in the code, I updated all the wind sections in our `yaml` files to use a seed, as this is how we're going to look during the events. I also removed the `symbol_controller` as seems unused these days.
values.title: Fix issue #92

summary.raw:
This pull request creates deterministic wind when the same seed is used.

How do I test it?

1\. Edit `vrx_gazebo/worlds/example_course.world.xacro` and replace the line `<xacro:usv_wind_gazebo>` with `<xacro:usv_wind_gazebo seed = "10">`.

2\. Additionally, add the following block of code in `usv_gazebo_plugins/src/usv_gazebo_wind_plugin.cc` after line 217 `double randomDist = dist(*this->randGenerator);` :

```
static int counter = 0;
if (counter < 3)
{
  std::cerr << randomDist << std::endl;
  ++counter;
}
```

3\. Recompile and launch VRX: `roslaunch vrx_gazebo vrx.launch`

4\. Confirm that you’re now using the custom seed:

```
[Msg] Random seed value = 10
```

and that you always get the same wind values for this seed:

```
-0.0512656
1.23919
-0.376303
```

‌

Besides the change in the code, I updated all the wind sections in our `yaml` files to use a seed, as this is how we're going to look during the events. I also removed the `symbol_controller` as seems unused these days.
summary.html:
This pull request creates deterministic wind when the same seed is used.

How do I test it?

1. Edit vrx_gazebo/worlds/example_course.world.xacro and replace the line <xacro:usv_wind_gazebo> with <xacro:usv_wind_gazebo seed = "10">.

2. Additionally, add the following block of code in usv_gazebo_plugins/src/usv_gazebo_wind_plugin.cc after line 217 double randomDist = dist(*this->randGenerator); :

static int counter = 0;
if (counter < 3)
{
  std::cerr << randomDist << std::endl;
  ++counter;
}

3. Recompile and launch VRX: roslaunch vrx_gazebo vrx.launch

4. Confirm that you’re now using the custom seed:

[Msg] Random seed value = 10

and that you always get the same wind values for this seed:

-0.0512656
1.23919
-0.376303

‌

Besides the change in the code, I updated all the wind sections in our yaml files to use a seed, as this is how we're going to look during the events. I also removed the symbol_controller as seems unused these days.

values.description:
* branch
* perception plugin refactored to be more fllexible
* styling and documentation

Demo: 

`roslaunch vrx_gazebo perception_task.launch verbose:=true`

in separate terminal run:

```
rostopic pub /vrx/perception/landmark geographic_msgs/GeoPoseStamped "header:
seq: 0
stamp:
secs: 0
nsecs: 0
frame_id: '<surmark_950410,surmark_950400, or black_totem>' 
pose:
position:
latitude: 0.0
longitude: 0.0
altitude: 0.0
orientation:
x: 0.0
y: 0.0
z: 0.0
w: 0.0"
```

to see how scoring and Attempt Balance Work

values.description:
THIS PR IS A WORK IN PROGRESS. Please refer to the most updated comments below to check which commits are stable and working \(to understand progress made\), and also which commits demonstrate what I am trying to do, which may not be working \(where I may need support\).

**What has been done**

The purpose of this PR is to experiment with Gazebo Visual Plugins to build towards ocean reflections. The major steps have been:

1. Removing all previous shader and material param setting from before \(not permanently, but done to simplify plugin for learning and experimentation\)
2. Create 2 entities:

    1. An Ogre plane aligned with the ocean waves with the render texture
    2. An Ogre Rectangle in the upper right corner to show what the render texture looks like
    
3. Use the user camera to create a rendertexture that updates to match what the user camera sees
4. Attempted reflection attempt

**What needs to be done and questions about it**

1. Currently, I create a new material and new texture in the C\+\+ code and do not use any shaders. I will need to implement the shaders and update the C\+\+ code to interact with the shaders and material script.

    1. An issue I had was that I could not modify the existing material or texture. If I had
    

```
texture_unit 
{
  texture reflectionTexture
  tex_address_mode clamp
}
```

and I tried to add to it with

```
 Ogre::TexturePtr rttTexture =$
   Ogre::TextureManager::getSingleton().createManual($
     "reflectionTexture",$
     Ogre::ResourceGroupManager::DEFAULT_RESOURCE_GROUP_NAME, $
     Ogre::TEX_TYPE_2D, $
     512, 512, $
     0, $
     Ogre::PF_R8G8B8, $
     Ogre::TU_RENDERTARGET);$
```

the ocean waves would not turn up. Perhaps I made some mistakes with it, but I tried at it for quite a while without success. Might need to look to see if there are errors in ogre.log

2\. I need to figure out the appropriate matrices needed the transform coordinates correctly in the vertex shader.

3\. Got working material on ocean with `this->visual->SetMaterial`, but could not work when using material script.

4\. Do I need to make a new ogre camera that is not the user camera’s ogre camera? When I tried making a new camera \(referred to Pro Ogre 3D Book\), I had difficulty positioning the camera to match the user camera pose \(move camera or camera node? diff coordinate systems?, etc\)

**I plan to add some commits showing more clearly what I am attempting to do, but isn’t working. Stable commits at** 1529:01aadf9da3d0 \(matches figure 4\), 1516:c46139ca81c8 \(shows upper right miniscreen and a small flat plane with render texture\),

**Incremental improvements and understanding**

‌

![](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/B-T_7m_By3yttge1fI63l-WYoT9nnVTeoqpvTLDzNYCjjxdHBYQoK9gXSf3DoPU4kPZ9KvmBBW-_qmsq6flGmkPNw3aly4HcSgos0pagT6M9-yeAg_8_IBQ7jokVvXg3s9KNtH3m)
Figure 1: Colored ocean with fragment shader based on position, created a plane with a cloud picture, and show a texture of the usercamera image in the upper right

![](https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/sqmhSaEHRsjdcAyKEtLJ3ttm_q3XP5esooZiT-TLTbi7pTN9MADsx4m1IUCYSZYa0xbUY6EgWJHX_ZUTcwbb9PQmF01ZeHdv_J5NFPbx-JCuxEKPxSi1FOuKCuLc5jfgHcaxDF6S)
Figure 2: Change miniscreen to no longer show a miniscreen inside of itself

‌

![](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/HCsEeJU2GbQgUNTnUnlQfYumeVvg8vMOtMuGPZMr3CgBZNN6txkRg3fFk9clHtLzLD9h775zWpiyT3OzJndd1xlTurmYZD3RzgLndNQOB1g9CJpG9ZmC15JB2JYHzSdgpQOzbatx)
Figure 3: Remove ocean shader and make plane display texture

‌

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/2044246195-image.png)
‌

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/1477922417-image.png)
Figure 4: Rotate plane to align with ocean waves and enable reflection \(shows non-working view from above and promsing view from below\)

‌

**Reference Material**

Ogre Render to Texture Tutorial [http://wiki.ogre3d.org/Intermediate\+Tutorial\+7](http://wiki.ogre3d.org/Intermediate+Tutorial+7)

Pro Ogre 3D Book [https://books.google.ca/books?id=GifUrbWat14C&pg=PA166&lpg=PA166&dq=ogre\+reflection&source=bl&ots=glk0q9tlDg&sig=ACfU3U2g\_Zg3zryST6pGEYVmzPOsE06i2w&hl=en&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwiXvIPFhYvkAhW2JTQIHdbGAdQQ6AEwDHoECAgQAQ#v=onepage&q&f=false](https://books.google.ca/books?id=GifUrbWat14C&pg=PA166&lpg=PA166&dq=ogre+reflection&source=bl&ots=glk0q9tlDg&sig=ACfU3U2g_Zg3zryST6pGEYVmzPOsE06i2w&hl=en&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwiXvIPFhYvkAhW2JTQIHdbGAdQQ6AEwDHoECAgQAQ#v=onepage&q&f=false)

Gazebo rendering source code https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/default/gazebo/rendering/

GLSL Shader Tutorial for Reflections [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GADTasvDOX4&list=PLRIWtICgwaX23jiqVByUs0bqhnalNTNZh&index=4](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GADTasvDOX4&list=PLRIWtICgwaX23jiqVByUs0bqhnalNTNZh&index=4)

Camera Positioning Tutorial [http://wiki.ogre3d.org/Simple\+3rd\+person\+camera](http://wiki.ogre3d.org/Simple+3rd+person+camera)

Fresnel Example from Ogre: [https://bitbucket.org/sinbad/ogre/src/v1-9-0/Samples/Fresnel/include/Fresnel.h](https://bitbucket.org/sinbad/ogre/src/v1-9-0/Samples/Fresnel/include/Fresnel.h) [https://bitbucket.org/sinbad/ogre/src/v1-9-0/Samples/Media/materials/scripts/Examples-Advanced.material](https://bitbucket.org/sinbad/ogre/src/v1-9-0/Samples/Media/materials/scripts/Examples-Advanced.material) [https://bitbucket.org/sinbad/ogre/src/v1-9-0/Samples/Media/materials/programs/GLSL150/Example\_FresnelFp.glsl](https://bitbucket.org/sinbad/ogre/src/v1-9-0/Samples/Media/materials/programs/GLSL150/Example_FresnelFp.glsl) [https://bitbucket.org/sinbad/ogre/src/v1-9-0/Samples/Media/materials/programs/GLSL150/Example\_FresnelVp.glsl](https://bitbucket.org/sinbad/ogre/src/v1-9-0/Samples/Media/materials/programs/GLSL150/Example_FresnelVp.glsl)
values.title: Learn Gazebo Visual Plugins for Ocean Reflections

THIS PR IS A WORK IN PROGRESS. Please refer to the most updated comments below to check which commits are stable and working \(to understand progress made\), and also which commits demonstrate what I am trying to do, which may not be working \(where I may need support\).

**What has been done**

The purpose of this PR is to experiment with Gazebo Visual Plugins to build towards ocean reflections. The major steps have been:

1. Removing all previous shader and material param setting from before \(not permanently, but done to simplify plugin for learning and experimentation\)
2. Create 2 entities:

    2. An Ogre Rectangle in the upper right corner to show what the render texture looks like

THIS PR IS A WORK IN PROGRESS. Please refer to the most updated comments below to check which commits are stable and working (to understand progress made), and also which commits demonstrate what I am trying to do, which may not be working (where I may need support).

What has been done

The purpose of this PR is to experiment with Gazebo Visual Plugins to build towards ocean reflections. The major steps have been:

  1. Removing all previous shader and material param setting from before (not permanently, but done to simplify plugin for learning and experimentation)

  2. Create 2 entities:

    1. An Ogre plane aligned with the ocean waves with the render texture
    2. An Ogre Rectangle in the upper right corner to show what the render texture looks like

  3. Use the user camera to create a rendertexture that updates to match what the user camera sees

  4. Attempted reflection attempt

What needs to be done and questions about it

  1. Currently, I create a new material and new texture in the C++ code and do not use any shaders. I will need to implement the shaders and update the C++ code to interact with the shaders and material script.

    1. An issue I had was that I could not modify the existing material or texture. If I had
texture_unit 
{
  texture reflectionTexture
  tex_address_mode clamp
}

and I tried to add to it with

 Ogre::TexturePtr rttTexture =$
   Ogre::TextureManager::getSingleton().createManual($
     "reflectionTexture",$
     Ogre::ResourceGroupManager::DEFAULT_RESOURCE_GROUP_NAME, $
     Ogre::TEX_TYPE_2D, $
     512, 512, $
     0, $
     Ogre::PF_R8G8B8, $
     Ogre::TU_RENDERTARGET);$

the ocean waves would not turn up. Perhaps I made some mistakes with it, but I tried at it for quite a while without success. Might need to look to see if there are errors in ogre.log

2. I need to figure out the appropriate matrices needed the transform coordinates correctly in the vertex shader.

3. Got working material on ocean with this->visual->SetMaterial, but could not work when using material script.

4. Do I need to make a new ogre camera that is not the user camera’s ogre camera? When I tried making a new camera (referred to Pro Ogre 3D Book), I had difficulty positioning the camera to match the user camera pose (move camera or camera node? diff coordinate systems?, etc)

I plan to add some commits showing more clearly what I am attempting to do, but isn’t working. Stable commits at 1529:01aadf9da3d0 (matches figure 4), 1516:c46139ca81c8 (shows upper right miniscreen and a small flat plane with render texture),

Incremental improvements and understanding

‌

Figure 1: Colored ocean with fragment shader based on position, created a plane with a cloud picture, and show a texture of the usercamera image in the upper right

Figure 2: Change miniscreen to no longer show a miniscreen inside of itself

‌

Figure 3: Remove ocean shader and make plane display texture

‌

‌

Figure 4: Rotate plane to align with ocean waves and enable reflection (shows non-working view from above and promsing view from below)

‌

Reference Material

Ogre Render to Texture Tutorial http://wiki.ogre3d.org/Intermediate+Tutorial+7

Pro Ogre 3D Book https://books.google.ca/books?id=GifUrbWat14C&pg=PA166&lpg=PA166&dq=ogre+reflection&source=bl&ots=glk0q9tlDg&sig=ACfU3U2g_Zg3zryST6pGEYVmzPOsE06i2w&hl=en&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwiXvIPFhYvkAhW2JTQIHdbGAdQQ6AEwDHoECAgQAQ#v=onepage&q&f=false

Gazebo rendering source code https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/default/gazebo/rendering/

GLSL Shader Tutorial for Reflections https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GADTasvDOX4&list=PLRIWtICgwaX23jiqVByUs0bqhnalNTNZh&index=4

Camera Positioning Tutorial http://wiki.ogre3d.org/Simple+3rd+person+camera

Fresnel Example from Ogre: https://bitbucket.org/sinbad/ogre/src/v1-9-0/Samples/Fresnel/include/Fresnel.h https://bitbucket.org/sinbad/ogre/src/v1-9-0/Samples/Media/materials/scripts/Examples-Advanced.material https://bitbucket.org/sinbad/ogre/src/v1-9-0/Samples/Media/materials/programs/GLSL150/Example_FresnelFp.glsl https://bitbucket.org/sinbad/ogre/src/v1-9-0/Samples/Media/materials/programs/GLSL150/Example_FresnelVp.glsl

values.title: Comment out missing files, as a workaround

summary.html:
Description

Currently, running the world generation script leads to errors that prevent it from running. This relates to not being able to find files.

Reproduce

  1. mkdir -p ~/my_worlds/world_xacros mkdir -p ~/my_worlds/worlds
  2. roslaunch vrx_gazebo generate_worlds.launch requested:=$HOME/vrx_ws/src/vrx/vrx_gazebo/worlds/yamls/dock_shallow.yaml world_xacro_target:=$HOME/my_worlds/world_xacros/ world_target:=$HOME/my_worlds/worlds/

Error

xacro: in-order processing became default in ROS Melodic. You can drop the option.
No such file or directory: /home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/vrx_gazebo/worlds/xacros/light_buoy.xacro
when instantiating macro: include_all_xacros (/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/vrx_gazebo/worlds/xacros/include_all_xacros.xacro)
in file: /home/tylerlum/my_worlds/world_xacros/worlds0.world.xacro
xacro: in-order processing became default in ROS Melodic. You can drop the option.
No such file or directory: /home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/vrx_gazebo/worlds/xacros/light_buoy.xacro
when instantiating macro: include_all_xacros (/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/vrx_gazebo/worlds/xacros/include_all_xacros.xacro)
in file: /home/tylerlum/my_worlds/world_xacros/worlds1.world.xacro
➜  vrx_gazebo ls worlds/xacros 
dock.xacro                nav_challenge.xacro  sandisland_minus_scene.xacro  scene.xacro           usv_wind_plugin.xacro
include_all_xacros.xacro  perception.xacro     scan_and_dock.xacro           stationkeeping.xacro  wayfinding.xacro

Expected files

<?xml version="1.0"?>
<world xmlns:xacro="http://ros.org/wiki/xacro">
  <xacro:macro name="include_all_xacros">
    <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/sandisland.xacro" />
    <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/xacros/sandisland_minus_scene.xacro" />
    <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/xacros/scene.xacro" />
    <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/xacros/nav_challenge.xacro" />
    <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/xacros/light_buoy.xacro" />
    <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/xacros/qualifying_pinger_transit_2016.xacro" />
    <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/xacros/dock_2016.xacro" />
    <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/xacros/dock_2018.xacro" />
    <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/xacros/scene_macro.xacro" />
    <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/xacros/usv_wind_plugin.xacro" />
    <xacro:include filename="$(find wave_gazebo)/world_models/ocean_waves/model.xacro"/>
    <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/xacros/perception.xacro" />
    <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/xacros/stationkeeping.xacro" />
    <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/xacros/dock.xacro" />
    <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/xacros/scan_and_dock.xacro" />
    <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/xacros/wayfinding.xacro" />
  </xacro:macro>
</world>

Workaround

diff -r 6a3fbf97e42a vrx_gazebo/worlds/xacros/include_all_xacros.xacro
--- a/vrx_gazebo/worlds/xacros/include_all_xacros.xacro Wed Aug 21 13:49:58 2019 -0600
+++ b/vrx_gazebo/worlds/xacros/include_all_xacros.xacro Wed Aug 21 14:25:51 2019 -0700
@@ -5,11 +5,11 @@
     <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/xacros/sandisland_minus_scene.xacro" />
     <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/xacros/scene.xacro" />
     <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/xacros/nav_challenge.xacro" />
-    <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/xacros/light_buoy.xacro" />
+    <!-- <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/xacros/light_buoy.xacro" />
     <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/xacros/qualifying_pinger_transit_2016.xacro" />
     <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/xacros/dock_2016.xacro" />
     <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/xacros/dock_2018.xacro" />
-    <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/xacros/scene_macro.xacro" />
+    <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/xacros/scene_macro.xacro" /> -->
     <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/xacros/usv_wind_plugin.xacro" />
     <xacro:include filename="$(find wave_gazebo)/world_models/ocean_waves/model.xacro"/>
     <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/xacros/perception.xacro" />

values.description:
**Description**

Currently, we are using oyaml for generating custom worlds and wamvs \(generate\_wamv.launch and generate\_worlds.launch\). This requires users to run `pip install oyaml` as per [[https://pypi.org/project/oyaml/](https://pypi.org/project/oyaml/)](https://pypi.org/project/oyaml). However, `pip` can lead to headaches. We should investigate if this is needed or not, and perhaps just use pyyaml.

**Where this is used**

```
➜  vrx_gazebo grep -r "yaml" | grep import
src/vrx_gazebo_python/generator_scripts/utils.py:import yaml
src/vrx_gazebo_python/generator_scripts/world_generator/generate_worlds.py:import oyaml as yaml
src/vrx_gazebo_python/generator_scripts/wamv_config/compliance.py:import yaml
```
values.title: Remove oyaml use

summary.raw:
**Description**

Currently, we are using oyaml for generating custom worlds and wamvs \(generate\_wamv.launch and generate\_worlds.launch\). This requires users to run `pip install oyaml` as per [[https://pypi.org/project/oyaml/](https://pypi.org/project/oyaml/)](https://pypi.org/project/oyaml). However, `pip` can lead to headaches. We should investigate if this is needed or not, and perhaps just use pyyaml.

**Where this is used**

```
➜  vrx_gazebo grep -r "yaml" | grep import
src/vrx_gazebo_python/generator_scripts/utils.py:import yaml
src/vrx_gazebo_python/generator_scripts/world_generator/generate_worlds.py:import oyaml as yaml

```
summary.html:
Description

Currently, we are using oyaml for generating custom worlds and wamvs (generate_wamv.launch and generate_worlds.launch). This requires users to run pip install oyaml as per [https://pypi.org/project/oyaml/](https://pypi.org/project/oyaml/). However, pip can lead to headaches. We should investigate if this is needed or not, and perhaps just use pyyaml.

Where this is used

➜  vrx_gazebo grep -r "yaml" | grep import
src/vrx_gazebo_python/generator_scripts/utils.py:import yaml
src/vrx_gazebo_python/generator_scripts/world_generator/generate_worlds.py:import oyaml as yaml
src/vrx_gazebo_python/generator_scripts/wamv_config/compliance.py:import yaml

values.description: This was creating some issues in the navigation scoring plugin. We might get some marginal performance gain removing the joint. Keep in mind that if we update the buoyancy properties of the totems in the future, we’ll have to do it for all of them.

values.description:
Added an explicit check to apply the effect only to camera sensors. This should fix the lidar readings.

Note that this also means other rendering based sensors like wide-angle camera / multi-camera sensors won’t see the reflection / refraction. We can add more checks if these sensors are used in VRX.
values.title: Apply ocean reflection / refraction only to camera sensors

summary.raw:
Added an explicit check to apply the effect only to camera sensors. This should fix the lidar readings.

Note that this also means other rendering based sensors like wide-angle camera / multi-camera sensors won’t see the reflection / refraction. We can add more checks if these sensors are used in VRX.
summary.html:
Added an explicit check to apply the effect only to camera sensors. This should fix the lidar readings.

Note that this also means other rendering based sensors like wide-angle camera / multi-camera sensors won’t see the reflection / refraction. We can add more checks if these sensors are used in VRX.

summary.raw: The camera aspect ratio is affected when object reflections are enabled. This patch fixes it.

values.description:
This is associated with getting the task generation going for the dock task. Two items addressed:

1. Adds a simple macro to a model - useful for adding multiple dock elements to docking tasks.
2. Exposes the wamv\_locked parameter to the vrx.launch file

    1. Without wamv is not fixed at beginning of task.
    2. Avoids the gazebo error:
    
        * `[Err] [scoring_plugin.cc:235] Unable to release [wamv_external_pivot_joint] [Err] [scoring_plugin.cc:235] Unable to release [wamv_external_riser]`
        
    

* simple macro for inserting a model - useful for task generation
* adding wamv\_locked argument to vrx.launch

‌
values.title: Tweaks for task generation

summary.raw:
This is associated with getting the task generation going for the dock task. Two items addressed:

1. Adds a simple macro to a model - useful for adding multiple dock elements to docking tasks.
2. Exposes the wamv\_locked parameter to the vrx.launch file

    1. Without wamv is not fixed at beginning of task.
    2. Avoids the gazebo error:
    
        * `[Err] [scoring_plugin.cc:235] Unable to release [wamv_external_pivot_joint] [Err] [scoring_plugin.cc:235] Unable to release [wamv_external_riser]`
        
    

* simple macro for inserting a model - useful for task generation

‌
summary.html:
This is associated with getting the task generation going for the dock task. Two items addressed:

  1. Adds a simple macro to a model - useful for adding multiple dock elements to docking tasks.

  2. Exposes the wamv_locked parameter to the vrx.launch file

    1. Without wamv is not fixed at beginning of task.

    2. Avoids the gazebo error:

      • [Err] [scoring_plugin.cc:235] Unable to release [wamv_external_pivot_joint] [Err] [scoring_plugin.cc:235] Unable to release [wamv_external_riser]
  • simple macro for inserting a model - useful for task generation
  • adding wamv_locked argument to vrx.launch

‌

values.description:
The buildfarm for ROS Noetic \(using Python 3\) is expected to be up and running by the end of October. I ran a Python 3 linter and made some initial changes. I don’t foresee many issues in `vrx` because we don’t have much Python code but we’ll look into it when we can properly test it with Noetic.

This is the command that I run to check Python 3 compatibility:

‌

```
for f in `find . | grep ".py$" | grep -v __init__.py`; do   pylint --py3k $f; done
```

‌
values.title: Python3 preparation

This is the command that I run to check Python 3 compatibility:

‌

values.description:
This addresses [Issue#166](#!/osrf/vrx/issues/166/first-sequence-of-light-buoy-is-not-synced) using approach 3. in the issue \(Change the default sequence defined in the robotx\_light\_buoy model.sdf \(and modify the light\_buoy\_plugin\) so that the buoy is “off” until the correct sequence is published.\)

Run `roslaunch vrx_gazebo scan_and_dock.launch verbose:=true extra_gazebo_args:="--pause"`

and then verify that the buoy is off and the correct sequence starts when transitioning to the Running state.
values.title: Light buoy starts off.

summary.raw:
This addresses [Issue#166](#!/osrf/vrx/issues/166/first-sequence-of-light-buoy-is-not-synced) using approach 3. in the issue \(Change the default sequence defined in the robotx\_light\_buoy model.sdf \(and modify the light\_buoy\_plugin\) so that the buoy is “off” until the correct sequence is published.\)

Run `roslaunch vrx_gazebo scan_and_dock.launch verbose:=true extra_gazebo_args:="--pause"`

and then verify that the buoy is off and the correct sequence starts when transitioning to the Running state.
summary.html:
This addresses Issue#166 using approach 3. in the issue (Change the default sequence defined in the robotx_light_buoy model.sdf (and modify the light_buoy_plugin) so that the buoy is “off” until the correct sequence is published.)

Run roslaunch vrx_gazebo scan_and_dock.launch verbose:=true extra_gazebo_args:="--pause"

and then verify that the buoy is off and the correct sequence starts when transitioning to the Running state.

values.description:
Currently our stationkeeping, wayfinding, dock and scan-and-dock tasks are not linked to the usv\_wind\_plugin by default. The navigation task is. This pull request adds the default usv\_wind\_plugin settings to worlds generated for all tasks except perception.

Is this what we want? I wasn’t sure so if not please reject the request.
values.title: Default Wind for Tasks

summary.raw:
Currently our stationkeeping, wayfinding, dock and scan-and-dock tasks are not linked to the usv\_wind\_plugin by default. The navigation task is. This pull request adds the default usv\_wind\_plugin settings to worlds generated for all tasks except perception.

Is this what we want? I wasn’t sure so if not please reject the request.
summary.html:
Currently our stationkeeping, wayfinding, dock and scan-and-dock tasks are not linked to the usv_wind_plugin by default. The navigation task is. This pull request adds the default usv_wind_plugin settings to worlds generated for all tasks except perception.

Is this what we want? I wasn’t sure so if not please reject the request.

values.description:
See issue #164.

‌

How to test it?

1. Launch VRX:

```
roslaunch vrx_gazebo dock.launch verbose:=true
```

1. Launch the teleoperation node:

```
roslaunch vrx_gazebo usv_joydrive.launch
```

1. Dock the WAM-V in the bay with the red circle \(incorrect one\) and check score:

```
rostopic echo /vrx/task/info
```

The simulation should stop and you should observe a score of 10 points. If you repeat the test and dock in the bay with the red cross \(correct one\), you should observe a score of 20 points.
values.title: Fixing dock scoring plugin for Gazebo 9

summary.html:
See issue #164.

‌

How to test it?

  1. Launch VRX:
roslaunch vrx_gazebo dock.launch verbose:=true
  1. Launch the teleoperation node:
roslaunch vrx_gazebo usv_joydrive.launch
  1. Dock the WAM-V in the bay with the red circle (incorrect one) and check score:
rostopic echo /vrx/task/info

The simulation should stop and you should observe a score of 10 points. If you repeat the test and dock in the bay with the red cross (correct one), you should observe a score of 20 points.

values.description:
* Adds additional debugging gazebo messages for docking - activation zones, etc.
* Removes spamming messages from collisions \(commented out\).
* Changes the activation zone visualization to be relative to the dock model - only for the floating docks at the moment.   Note that transparent gazebo colors look a bit odd, so sticking with transparency of zero.
* Moved our example docking world dock closer to initial pose of the WAMV to facilitate easier testing.

* 

‌
values.title: Relative bay visualization

summary.raw:
* Adds additional debugging gazebo messages for docking - activation zones, etc.
* Removes spamming messages from collisions \(commented out\).
* Changes the activation zone visualization to be relative to the dock model - only for the floating docks at the moment.   Note that transparent gazebo colors look a bit odd, so sticking with transparency of zero.
* Moved our example docking world dock closer to initial pose of the WAMV to facilitate easier testing.

* 

‌
summary.html:
• Adds additional debugging gazebo messages for docking - activation zones, etc.
  • Removes spamming messages from collisions (commented out).
  • Changes the activation zone visualization to be relative to the dock model - only for the floating docks at the moment. Note that transparent gazebo colors look a bit odd, so sticking with transparency of zero.

  • Moved our example docking world dock closer to initial pose of the WAMV to facilitate easier testing.

‌

values.description:
This replaces our preliminary heading error with something that makes more sense in the stationkeeping and wayfinding tasks. It also replaces rmsError in the stationkeeping task with a meanError score instead, which means changing the interface. The reason for changing it is that, with the switch to the new heading error, our instantaneous poseError is now a sum of headingError and Euclidean distance from the goal.

If this is acceptable we should update the documentation and maybe also put up a forum post. An alternative would be to keep the rmsError topic and just have it publish the new version of the score. It would no longer really be what it says it is, but this might be unimportant.
values.title: Heading error weight

summary.raw:
This replaces our preliminary heading error with something that makes more sense in the stationkeeping and wayfinding tasks. It also replaces rmsError in the stationkeeping task with a meanError score instead, which means changing the interface. The reason for changing it is that, with the switch to the new heading error, our instantaneous poseError is now a sum of headingError and Euclidean distance from the goal.

If this is acceptable we should update the documentation and maybe also put up a forum post. An alternative would be to keep the rmsError topic and just have it publish the new version of the score. It would no longer really be what it says it is, but this might be unimportant.
summary.html:
This replaces our preliminary heading error with something that makes more sense in the stationkeeping and wayfinding tasks. It also replaces rmsError in the stationkeeping task with a meanError score instead, which means changing the interface. The reason for changing it is that, with the switch to the new heading error, our instantaneous poseError is now a sum of headingError and Euclidean distance from the goal.

If this is acceptable we should update the documentation and maybe also put up a forum post. An alternative would be to keep the rmsError topic and just have it publish the new version of the score. It would no longer really be what it says it is, but this might be unimportant.

values.description:
This is in support of automatic task/trial generations.  It prepares an empty directory to hold a bunch of automatically generated dock models.  It also tweaks the world generation script to allow calling the same macro multiple times in a single trial - this is useful for adding multiple docks to a single trial.

‌

* working on brute force docking solution
* adding empty directory
* getting ready to merge
* tweak to generator to allow calling same macro more than once

‌
values.title: Dock permutations

values.description:
Add a parameter to optionally disable to color checker and expose the parameter in the dock.xacro macro.  Useful when you have more than one dock model in the same world.

‌

* 
* Functionality to turn off color checker in the scan\_dock\_scoring\_plugin
* style

‌
